description: Early development of microbiology, pathology, and immunobiology; molecular and cellular bases of immune phenomena including: immunity to pathogens, immune diseases, autoimmunity, and hypersensitivity.
name: IMMUNOBIOLOGY

values.comments:
Topics covered include: early development of microbiology, pathology, and
immunobiology; molecular and cellular bases of immune phenomena including immunity
to pathogens, immune diseases, autoimmunity, and hypersensitivity.
Students described the course material as “interesting,” but very “tough.” They
felt that the course was “well-organized” and graded on a “straight scale,” which students
said made it easier to know what was needed to get a desired grade.
Professor Cancro was beloved by his students. Many gave him credit for making
a daunting subject accessible. He was seen as “thorough and entertaining,” and many
students referred to him as one of the top professors at Penn.
Students felt that there was a lot of work involved in this class: blackboard
postings, quizzes, take home and in class midterms, and a research paper; however, they
also felt that all of these components really added to the course and the knowledge that
they took away. The course was recommended for all majors and pre-med students.
